pli-tv-pvr2.9:0.2: The nuns’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-pvr2.9:0.4: The section on where it was laid down
pli-tv-pvr2.9:1.0: 1. The chapter on offenses entailing expulsion
pli-tv-pvr2.9:1.1: “The offense entailing expulsion that is a result of consenting to physical contact was laid down by the Buddha who knows and sees, the Perfected One, the fully Awakened One. Where was it laid down?
pli-tv-pvr2.9:2.1: Where was that offence involving Defeat on the ground of consenting to physical contact laid down by that Lord … ?
pli-tv-pvr2.9:2.2: It was laid down in Sāvatthī
pli-tv-pvr2.9:2.26: she originates it by body and by mind, not by speech …
pli-tv-pvr2.9:2.27: By whom has it been conveyed?
pli-tv-pvr2.9:2.28: It has been conveyed by a succession (of teachers):
pli-tv-pvr2.9:5.3: … Vinaya-piṭaka in the Island of Tambapaṇṇi. [1]
pli-tv-pvr2.9:6.1: Where was that offence involving Defeat on the ground of concealing a fault laid down …
pli-tv-pvr2.9:6.8: she originates it by one origin
pli-tv-pvr2.9:7.1: Where was that offence involving Defeat on the ground of not giving up (her course) though being admonished up to the third time laid down …
pli-tv-pvr2.9:8.1: Where was that offence involving Defeat on the ground of completing the eighth thing laid down …
pli-tv-pvr2.9:8.10: Concluded are the Offences involving Defeat
pli-tv-pvr2.9:9.1: Where was that offence requiring a Formal Meeting of the Order because of the bringing of a law-suit by a nun who speaks in envy laid down?
pli-tv-pvr2.9:10.27: she originates it by body and by speech and by mind …
pli-tv-pvr2.9:10.28: By whom has it been conveyed?
pli-tv-pvr2.9:13.3: … Vinaya-piṭaka in the Island of Tambapaṇṇi. [1]
pli-tv-pvr2.9:14.1: … requiring a Formal Meeting of the Order because of ordaining a woman thief …
pli-tv-pvr2.9:14.10: she originates it … and by mind. [2]
pli-tv-pvr2.9:15.1: … requiring a Formal Meeting of the Order because of going alone among villages … (as) in the first Defeat. [3]
pli-tv-pvr2.9:16.1: … requiring a Formal Meeting of the Order because of restoring a nun suspended by a complete Order, without having obtained permission from the Order which carried out the proceedings in accordance with the rule, with Discipline, with the Teacher’s instruction, not having learnt the group’s desire …
pli-tv-pvr2.9:17.1: … requiring a Formal Meeting of the Order because of a nun who is filled with desire partaking of solid food or soft food that with her own hand she has accepted from the hand of a man who is filled with desire …
pli-tv-pvr2.9:18.1: … requiring a Formal Meeting of the Order because of instigating (by) saying, “What can this man, whether he is filled with desire or is not filled with desire, do to you, lady, since you are not filled with desire?
pli-tv-pvr2.9:18.2: Please, lady, eat or partake of the solid food or the soft food that this man is giving to you and that you have accepted with your own hand” …
pli-tv-pvr2.9:19.1: … requiring a Formal Meeting of the Order because of a nun who is angry not giving up (her course) though being admonished up to the third time …
pli-tv-pvr2.9:20.1: … requiring a Formal Meeting of the Order because of a nun, overthrown in some legal question, not giving up (her course) though being admonished up to the third time …
pli-tv-pvr2.9:21.1: … requiring a Formal Meeting of the Order because of nuns who live in company not giving up (their course) though being admonished up to the third time …
pli-tv-pvr2.9:22.1: … requiring a Formal Meeting of the Order because of not giving up (her course) though being admonished up to the third time for one who is instigating saying, “Ladies, live you as though in company, do not you live otherwise” …
pli-tv-pvr2.9:23.1: … offence to be Confessed because of partaking of curds, having had them asked for …
pli-tv-pvr2.9:23.8: she originates it by four origins. [8]
pli-tv-pvr2.9:23.9: Concluded is the First Chapter: on Laying-Down-Where
